item.title: Beth add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "If you care about something you have to protect it – If you’re lucky enough to find a way of life you love, you have to find the courage to live it." -- John Irving

item.title: Beth add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Beth add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Beth add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "It had turned out that climbing a tree was more difficult than it looked. It was harder than warrior pose in yoga, than teaser in Pilates, than the elliptical or the Reformer. Rebecca thought that if no one had thought of it yet, soon enough someone in the city would spearhead a craze for tree climbing in Central and Prospect Parks, and it would become the talk of every cocktail party: have you tried that large oak by the Sheep Meadow? Oh, it’s completely changed my body." -- Anna Quindlen
